etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Rymer Jones (1810–1880), morphologist and physiologist. From scientific Latin Alcyonaria, group name + -an

definitions: Belonging to the Alcyonaria, a group of anthozoan cnidarians comprising the soft corals, having polyps with eight pinnate tentacles; of or relating to this group.

notes.text: The group is now a subclass that also includes the gorgonians and sea pens; its usual name is now Octocorallia.
